author: algaetoken
title: Sustainable Ecosystem Hub
description: The community generally lack education on alternative options for positive choices on Cardano that have a positive impact on health and the environment

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is good and certainly suited to the challenge of providing solutions that help solve environmental problems. The idea behind the proposal is to build a community hub that provides educational videos and infographics about sustainable business models, with real-life solutions to climate problems, that encourages participate in the Cardano ecosystem. Here people can chat and discuss environmental issues and proposed solutions. The creation of educational videos and infographics about sustainable business models that provide answers to solutions, focusing on Health, Nutrition, Climate, Society and environmental issues ... for people to interact and be educated about solutions that impact society. Enabling the Cardano community to join and become a decentralized business providing solutions to global warming, securing food and ending malnutrition while promoting acceptance and awareness about Cardano. This proposal aims to promote education and social media marketing, as well as the environmental aspects of projects located within the Cardno ecosystem. The vision of this proposal is clear and the result without this Proposal has a positive impact on Cardano and humanity
f6_assessments.q1: It's positive that this project has been and is alive, some major work has been done such as setting up educational videos, infographics, and community hubs. In addition, the proposed team also cooperates with projects that have an impact on Cardano such as Cardano4Climate, Climate Neutral Cardano, and SustainableADA....this shows the desire and direction of the proposed group. There is a roadmap with timeframes provided for 3 months. We know how long the whole project will take and what to expect each month. The activities involved are accounted for and we know well what will happen in each subsequent month, i.e., our visualization of the process is pretty solid. As for the budget, the proposal asks for $14,820, and we have a good understanding of the details of how that money is divided. I think the value is not high, compared to other proposals, but it is still basic that we understand the need for this amount, as it is done. And finally, about the project team, which is 3 members, and based on what was provided I think this is a well-qualified team, and details are given on what they can help ensure about bringing the development outlined in this proposal to success. So given the size of this proposal, I don't see a problem if it gets funded.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of the proposal is excellent, the author offers a lot of ways to be able to audit the project. The team identifies measurable deliverables that provide us with enough information to audit project progress and implementation. Proposal KPIs are defined, easily measured, and tracked within the first 3 months of funding. The team also explained how successful the project was, setting multiple goals. However, it would be nice if the proponent needed to establish some way in which the Cardano community can access this information.

f6_assessments.q0:
-	There is definitely a much needed hub for bringing together all initiatives related to sustainability, in the Cardano Ecosystem and even beyond. A community driven space where people can learn from each other, participate in, or even finance sustainability related projects can serve as a momentum that pushes towards a direction of travel, hence reducing fragmentation or dissipation of efforts.
-	The service can scale into a DAO, with a diversity of sectors including sustainable impact finance, carbon sequestration impact, regenerative agriculture and eventually scale to a global level.
-	This submission therefore is a seed that can grow into a major forest. Networks effects, partnerships and quality (educational) material will surely be key in paving the way forward.
f6_assessments.q1:
-	Business model : 
o	The hub being proposed, starting off as a community through some partnerships Cardano4Climate, SustainableADA, Blockchain Learning Centre, Climate Neutral Cardano etc) will surely benefit from the activities listed in Month 1, to consolidate the content and communications plan.
o	The budget estimate including content creation however appears to be conservative for and may need to be reviewed upwards based on quotes from design agencies to actually create the quality content being targetted.
o	If budget needs to be limited, maybe content creation as well could be driven by co-creation within the community and some incentivisation tokenomics for content creation may become handy.
o	It may be useful as well to develop a business model canvas, to list out all the hypothesis for the business model and test them out, so that the team can pivot as quickly as needed. (https://leanstartup.co/social-good/ )
o	Since social media communications is a key strategy, it may benefit the team to partner with (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/422219) Decentralized Social Intelligence submission (https://app.getmainline.com/ ) to see how best social media related metrics could be captured for the content strategy being developed.
-	Technology
o	It may be useful for the team to consider launchpads like Revuto, Cardashift (https://www.cardanocube.io/cardano-ecosystem-interactive-map) for kicking off their platform and possibly seek funding from the initial private sale through these platforms
o	Some other collaboration through blockfrost.io (https://blockfrost.io/) , specially for usage of Cardano APIs or IPFS for distributed file storage for the promotional content being created, could be of interest.
f6_assessments.q2:
-	The KPIs listed by the team are indeed pretty thorough for the first 3 months. These are activity based and it may benefit the team to consider from outcome related KPIs which could be developed via Mainline
o	How many key influencers have been targetted and retained by the communication campaign
o	Reach of content in various geographies on social media, and whether there is a need for creating content in multiple languages for acquiring a global community base
o	Registrations for partipation for launchpad based initial token offering
o	Some preliminary research on pricing for the tokens.
